posts.cooked:
basically, the robot will drive just fine but it won’t rotate correctly.

ex 1. Quals 63 we tried to make the robot rotate to face the note we bonk to collect it. instead it rotates 90 degrees off.

ex 2. Quals 76 at this point we had made an auto that theoretically would not rotate at all and you can see it try to rotate before it hits the stage

At the comp I posted those two vids from we were using path planner and had a functional pose estimation going. I also tested it with choreo (still using path planner lib) and dead reckoning and it still did not rotate.

edit: here’s code link too GitHub - 3100-Robotics/robot-2024: code for our 2024 robot

link_counts.title: Quals 63 - Northern Lights Regional 2024 - The Blue Alliance
Quals 76 - Northern Lights Regional 2024 - The Blue Alliance

posts.name: Brandon McDonald
posts.cooked: Can you please share screenshots of your paths and autos?

posts.name: Andy Gasser
posts.cooked:
This sounds like a gyro problem. You should make sure your gyro is reading values in the correct direction. When the robot rotates counter-clockwise (left), the gyro value should get larger .

You should also confirm you configured the omnimount feature, and calibration is also recommended. YAGSL has a great page about setting up the NavX.

Calibrating a NavX 2

posts.name: Sam Maier
posts.cooked: Another possibility is that your path follower rotation PID is too low/0. I couldn’t quite track how you set these values , but drive.swerveController.config.headingPIDF.p should be roughly 5.

this is what the first example path was like (with a different start pose) image 620×557 31.5 KB

image 620×557 31.5 KB

image 620×557 31.5 KB

this is what the second example was trying to do image 640×567 36.1 KB

image 640×567 36.1 KB

image 640×567 36.1 KB

this is what I was using to test rotation after our comp

edit: oop replied to wrong person
I believe I did try to set it at least that high while debugging at comp and that didn’t change anything

ok I’ve done a bit more testing and it actually looks like the robot is actively trying to point forward and not turn. if I run this path, with a really high heading p it will ossilate back and forth between facing forward
oh it also works in simulation so I don’t think pathplannerlib is configured incorrectly.

posts.name: Alex
posts.cooked: Could there be something overriding the attempts to turn? I would check out what you’re running in Autonomous, and see if there’s anything else that could be taking control.
turns out it doesn’t work in sim either
